content:
Weller Pottery was a pottery company based in Zanesville, Ohio that was known for producing high-quality art pottery and ceramics. The company was founded in 1872 by Samuel Weller and his sons, who started out making utilitarian pottery items such as flower pots and jugs. Over time, the company began to focus more on producing decorative pottery and art ceramics, and it became known for its high-quality glazes and innovative designs.

Weller Pottery was particularly known for its use of matte glazes, which were popular in the early 20th century. The company also produced a wide range of pottery and ceramic pieces, including vases, figurines, and decorative objects. Many of these pieces featured detailed and intricate designs, and they were often inspired by nature and the Arts and Crafts movement.

Weller Pottery operated until 1948, when it was forced to close due to declining sales and increased competition from other pottery companies. Today, Weller Pottery is highly sought after by collectors and is considered to be some of the finest art pottery produced in the United States.
